CITE Examples


The Examples directory

The easiest way to learn to use CITE is to check out the examples. The fortran examples are kernels from several applications. Each of the examples are in their own directory with a Makefile. The Makefiles have examples of compiler options/flags that generate the necessary files for CITE to use.

The examples are all located in /usr/lib/cite/examples. Most of the examples at present are fortran ones. There is a small daxpy C example. In future there will be more C examples and some C++ ones as well.

The interchange and matrix multiply examples that were used earlier are both there in the /usr/lib/cite/examples/{interchange,mm} directories.

For some examples of how inlining (using IPA) affects the choice of inner loops, check out the /usr/lib/cite/examples/inlining-btrix example.


Suresh Srinivas (ssuresh@mti)
